page.title: 16LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN CLOPHILL
page.content:
{Clophill}affairs are run by the{Parish {Council}& by{Mid.Beds.District Council The{major concern}at present is the proposed{Site for Disposal of Nuclear {Waste}at nearby{Elstow.}Most local people object to the plan.
We have a{sewage works}on our southern border, well away from the village. We have our own{Community Policeman who keeps an eye on everyone. There is occasional vandalism but there is very little trouble.
There is a{Clophill Charity}which provides a monetary grant at Christmas to{Widows & Pensioners.}It also gives grants for{Youth Projects}in the village as well as owning a number of {allotments}for renting by residents. Some{allotments}are also administered by the{Parish Council.
